title: GC tracing gap in ListEnumerator/DictionaryEnumerator
description: ListEnumerator and DictionaryEnumerator hold references to backing collections, but their trace() methods do not allow the GC to update those references if objects are relocated. This could cause use-after-free during GC.

title: Scanner case fallthrough without annotation
description: In src/compiler/Scanner.cc, a switch case may fall through unintentionally without a break or [[fallthrough]] annotation.

title: Use move semantics for VM stack pop/peek
description: In src/runtime/VirtualMachine.cc, values are copied off the stack rather than moved. Since Value contains a variant with heap-owning types (Strong<String>, etc.), this causes unnecessary ref-count bumps in hot paths. Pop/peek should use std::move.

title: Compiler stale variable reference after resize
description: In src/compiler/Compiler.cc, a variable reference may become stale after a container resize or scope exit, leading to use-after-free or incorrect data.

title: Function does not trace bytecode constants in GC
description: In src/runtime/Value.cc, Function's trace() method does not walk the constants table in its bytecode. GC-managed objects stored as constants could be collected prematurely, leading to dangling references.

title: Float-to-int truncation causes undefined behavior
description: In src/runtime/VirtualMachine.cc, float-to-integer conversions do not check for overflow. A float value outside int64_t range produces undefined behavior on cast.

title: Return globals/exports by const reference instead of by value
description: Several lookup functions return Value by value rather than by const&, causing unnecessary copies. These should return by const reference.

title: Add [[nodiscard]] to Result<T, E> type
description: The Result type should be marked [[nodiscard]] to prevent silently ignoring error returns at call sites.

title: Replace ostringstream with direct string append for concatenation
description: The VM's string concatenation path uses ostringstream, which is slow. Direct std::string::append or reserve + += would be significantly faster.

title: Remove unreachable return statements in visitor methods
description: Several visitor methods have unreachable 'return true' after exhaustive switches that already return in every case. This dead code could mask future bugs if a new case is added without a corresponding handler.

title: Modulo-by-zero undefined behavior in VM
description: In src/runtime/VirtualMachine.cc, the OP_MODULO handler does not check for a zero divisor before performing %. Integer modulo-by-zero is undefined behavior in C++.

title: Bytecode::addLocal checks wrong size
description: In src/compiler/Bytecode.cc, the local count check in addLocal likely compares against the wrong limit or container size, allowing incorrect behavior.

title: List::setSubscript out-of-bounds write
description: In src/runtime/Value.cc, List::setSubscript does not bounds-check before writing. An out-of-range index will write past the vector's end, causing undefined behavior.

title: Hash/equality contract violation in Value
description: In src/runtime/Value.cc, the hash function and equality operator do not agree for some value types. Objects that compare equal may hash differently, corrupting dictionary lookups.

title: Use std::string_view for read-only string parameters in scanner/parser
description: Consider using std::string_view for read-only string parameters in the scanner and parser hot paths to avoid unnecessary string copies.
